com.github.espinosamanuel.ggk.main

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.espinosamanuel.ggk.main.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the implementation of The Goose Game. You can find the complete requirements at xpeppers/goose-game-kata.
    Since:
    31/10/2021
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Manuel Espinosa

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Constructor, creates a new game with empty player and position maps and the running attribute set to false.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Constructor, creates a new game with empty player and position maps and the running attribute set to false.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This method orchestrates the phases of the game. Any errors within the game are handled here.

      • move

        public java.lang.String move(Player player,
                             int diceA,
                             int diceB)
        This method manages the movement of a player by also covering Win, Bridge, Goose, and Bounce scenarios.
        Parameters:
        player - is the player to move
        diceA - is the result of a dice roll
        diceB - is the result of a dice roll
        Returns:
        String Returns a custom message for each scenario.

      • addPlayer

        public java.lang.String addPlayer(java.lang.String addInstruction)
        This method allows you to insert a player by entering the add instruction from the keyboard. It does not allow to add users already present in the game and performs validation on the instruction received.
        Parameters:
        addInstruction - is the string received from the keyboard
        Returns:
        String Return a message containing a validation error or the notification of correct addition of a player

      • playersToString

        public java.lang.String playersToString()
        Returns:
        This method returns the comma separated list of players.

      • resolveMarkers

        public java.lang.String resolveMarkers(java.lang.String message,
                                       java.lang.String player,
                                       java.lang.Integer source,
                                       java.lang.Integer target,
                                       java.lang.Integer diceA,
                                       java.lang.Integer diceB)
        This method replaces in the input string the value of the markers passed as parameter.
        Parameters:
        message - is the string in which the markers will have to be replaced
        player - is the player name
        source - is the value for the marker "###source###"
        target - is the value for the marker "###target###"
        diceA - is the value for the marker "###diceA###"
        diceB - is the value for the marker "###diceB###"
        Returns:
        String returns the parameter after replacements have been made.

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,Player> getPlayers()

      • setPlayers

        public void setPlayers(java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,Player> players)

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()

      • setRunning

        public void setRunning(boolean running)
